sections.heading: Motion
sections.text: to postpone trial on ground of absence of evidence.

sections.text: of witnesses in case of postponement; actions involving title to mining claims.

sections.heading: Preferences
Drawing
sections.text: and examination of jurors; administration of oath or affirmation.

sections.text: to jurors; peremptory challenges.

sections.heading: Grounds
sections.text: for challenges for cause.

sections.heading: Challenges
sections.text: for cause tried by court.

sections.heading: Jury
sections.text: to be sworn; court may order jury into custody of officer.

sections.heading: Discharge
sections.text: and replacement of jurors who become unable or disqualified to perform duties.

sections.heading: Order
sections.text: of proceedings after jury has been sworn.

sections.heading: Jury
sections.text: may view property or premises.

sections.heading: Instructions
sections.text: to jury.

sections.text: of jury: How and where conducted.

sections.heading: Jury
sections.text:
may take papers, materials and notes of testimony when retiring for

deliberation.

sections.heading: Jury
sections.text: may come into court for further instructions.

sections.heading: Action
sections.text: may be tried again when jury discharged or prevented from giving verdict.

sections.heading: Court
sections.text: may adjourn from time to time while jury absent; sealed verdict.

sections.text: of jury.

sections.text: jury; recording verdict and discharging jury.

sections.heading: Two
sections.text: of three masters may act.
